By a 5-4 vote, the Court struck down the District of Columbia's ban on handguns, declaring for the first time that the Constitution protects not just gun ownership connected with military service, but private gun ownership for self defense.

Writing for the court majority, Justice Antonin Scalia said handguns are the preferred weapons for self defense, because in his words, a handgun can be pointed at a burglar with one hand while the other hand dials the police.
